forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. South southwest wind around 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight deepens over Downtown San Francisco, the city breathes in a veil of clouds, signaling the approach of evening rain. Currently, the air feels refreshingly brisk, just shy of 53 degrees, while the south-southwest wind whispers through the streets at a gentle pace. The promise of rain showers looms on the horizon, ready to make their presence felt after hours, with a 60% chance that the heavens may spill softly into the burgeoning night. It’s an invitation to wrap yourself snugly in layers; a light jacket paired with a cozy sweater would be prudent as you venture out.

The forecast for tomorrow suggests a dance of weather conditions, with rain likely to persist amidst brief moments of sunshine. Expect the high to touch a mild 58 degrees, with cooling temperatures as the afternoon unfolds. With gusts scaling up to 24 mph, the wind will playfully tussle at your coat’s edges, making it more vital to be attired appropriately for the fluctuating conditions. In these moments, as you ponder your evening plans, consider a visit to a favorite café, where you can savor the rich warmth of a fresh brew while watching the clouds weave their stories overhead. As day turns to night, embrace the quieter side of the city, perhaps a stroll through your neighborhood, absorbing the atmosphere that only a rainy evening can conjure.
